name: LLDS Grab Bag
description:
Econ: Slow start but steady later. Either test run magnum, setup underworld(s), or install Private. Aesops will net a lot mid game. Inside man can help a bit too.

Grab Bag: Get the connections you need with hostage. Test run for missing programs. Source to slow down FA. Flint to punish bad pub.

Breakers: Lots of options. Plop whatever is most efficient on Dino. Recur inti and fairie for LLDS. If game goes long you can fit: Magnum, Dino-breaker, ZU13 (no mem), and two others.

Not a ton of testing yet, so I welcome thoughts and improvements.

Bonus note: against non-flatliners inside man turns plascrete into an easy mark with Aesops :)

name: Do Bioroids ever advance?
description:
A try on the usually NBN-associated "Never advance" play style. I typically use my two clicks (for whatever) and then play a card in my remote. The runner does not know if it's an agenda that i can score next round or a trap or an upgrade or GRNDL refinery. Needs more testing, but is fun to play so far.

Needs some skill and luck to place the ICE efficiently, Dont try to kill the runner, go for your agendas. I he gets brain damage along the way, this will make him very causious.

name: è_é - v 0.3
description: I would very much appreciate your comments and suggestions ;)

name: Kate: A first try (help welcomed)
description:
I was going for a rig where I wouldn't have to pay for installing as much or paying to use the ice breakers.

I only have C&C and opening moves data packs at this point...

name: Pum Pum Haas
description: Shutdown Diagnostics Combo or punitive archived punitive combo

name: NBN 10-10-10-10
description: 10 agendas,10 economic cards,10 ices,10 cards for fast advance.

name: StreetKnight
description: Play with this for a long time.Works pretty well,but it seems cannot deal with too much damage.Now I'm thinking how to deal with Jinteki from Honor and Profit.

name: NEXT Shutdown v1
description:
Shutdown, Shutdown and more Shutdown! Primary targets are the the cheap, annoying stuff like Datasuckers, Fairies, Inti's, Clone Chips, SMC etc.

Use Jackson/Archived Memories to recur Shutdowns or random bad trashes from the deck from Shutdown or ABT.

Use ABT and Pri Req for free ICE. Important as econ is tight,as in all NEXT decks I seem to find.

Feedback welcome

name: LLDS Grab Bag v2.0
description:
Econ: Slow start but steady later. Either test run magnum, setup underworld(s), or install Private. Aesops will net a lot mid game. Inside man can help a bit too.

Grab Bag: Get the connections you need with hostage. Test run for missing programs. Source to slow down FA.

Breakers: Plop whatever is most efficient on Dino. Recur inti and fairie for LLDS. If game goes long you can fit: Magnum, Dino-breaker, ZU13 (no mem), and two others. Femme to get around really expensive ice.

Not a ton of testing yet, so I welcome thoughts and improvements.

Bonus note: against non-flatliners inside man turns plascrete into an easy mark with Aesops :)

name: GRNDL Shutdown
description:
A Power Shutdown / Accelerated Diagnostics deck with a few other win conditions.

Ways to win: - Score an early over-advanced Atlas. Draw basically any two combo cards - Double punitive after a big agenda steal. - Power Shutdown / Jackson / Accelerated - Score 7 agenda points (less likely)

Econ is a little light, but if you can nail an early restructure then you're set for a while, with the cheap ice. I've been going back and forth between GRNDL and Melange. Since you're only going to have one secure remote (if that), I prefer the bursty-er nature of GRNDL. In two turns (and 6 clicks) you can net 12 credits. With melange you can only net 7 credits in 2 turns (though for only 4 clicks).

If they have a plascrete out and 5 cards, then you either need a really lucky double-punitive or a pre-advanced vulcan. Its tough. Usually you'll have to shutdown the plascrete to have a chance.

I'd love to sneak in some potential early brain damage, but influence is sparse with GRNDL.

name: Checkmate
description: Intended to emphasize Reina's ability and to pressure all three central servers (R&D, Archives, and HQ, in that order).

name: Floating Wizard 2.0
description:
A tag-me deck I've been rather succesful with.

Notable cards:
Wyldside as a drawing engine
Knight as main breaker
Deep Red as console, all the MU I need, and I can clone chip a Knight mid-run.

I've had 2 decking-wins with it, mostly thanks to installing DLR right after an Account Siphon, and using it for 2 turns, before it's trashed, and a well timed Medium Demolition Run.

Any thoughts?
